page.title: 04CONSERVATION
page.content: As most of the area lies within the Peak District National Park there are restrictions protecting the ecology of the area. This ensures a high degree of awareness towards general aspects of conservation. Access to the area is limited mainly to ramblers, and long-distance walkers who are served by the Pennine Way (Alternative Route). The threat of extensive footpath erosion, has been averted by a planned fencing project keeping walkers to set routes. Further dangers are presented by excessive drainage eroding the peat bogs. This has been greatly reduced by water catchment canals constructed by Yorkshire Water Authority. Such works plus careful construction of the reservoirs aid the maintenance of conservation in this region. Pollution was a problem in the past.
